string.text: Killed a $what in $where. Solo.
Took down a $what. $where. By myself.
Just bagged a $what in $where. No backup needed.
$what's dead. $where. Solo kill.
Dropped a $what solo near $where. Still alive, somehow.
Got a $what kill. Alone. $where. Yeah, I know how it sounds.
$what corpse in $where with my name on it. Solo work.
Killed a $what by myself. $where. Check the body if you don't believe me.
Just solo'd a $what. $where. My gun's still hot.
One $what down. One stalker standing. $where.
Bullshit. No way you killed a $what alone.
Yeah right. You'd need a fucking tank to solo a $what.
Solo? A $what? I call bullshit.
$what kills require squads. You're full of shit.
I don't buy it. $what would tear you apart.
Pics or it didn't happen. $what solo is suicide.
You expect me to believe you solo'd a $what? Come on.
That's a nice story. Now tell me what actually happened.
$what solo? Suuuure. And I'm the Zone's tooth fairy.
I've seen veterans die to $what in groups. You're lying.
Check the corpse yourself if you don't believe me.
Or good positioning and a shotgun. Your call.
Body's still warm in $where. Go look.
Believe what you want. I'm still here, it's still dead.
Two heads, both full of buckshot. Check it.
I've got the bullet holes to prove it. You've got excuses.
My medkits are empty and my ammo's gone. That sound like bullshit?
Whatever. Corpse is in $where when you're ready to apologize.
Used 47 rounds. Want to count the holes?
I didn't survive to argue with you. Go verify it yourself.
I saw it. $who's gun was still smoking. It's real.
Can confirm. $what corpse is in $where. $who ain't lying.
Was there. Saw the whole thing. $who actually did it.
Two heads, both dead. $who's telling the truth.
I watched it happen. $who is either lucky or skilled. Probably both.
Body's fresh. $who killed it maybe an hour ago. I was there.
Verified. $what's dead, $who's alive. Math checks out.
Saw $who limping back covered in blood. $what's blood. It happened.
I was skeptical too. Then I saw the corpse. $who did it.
Counted the bullet casings. $who used every round. Real fight.
Damn... alright, I believe you. Drinks on me tonight.
Fuck me. You actually did it. Respect.
Okay, I was wrong. That's impressive. And terrifying.
Alright, alright. You're either brave or insane. Probably both.
Solo $what kill. Didn't think it was possible. My mistake.
You've got balls. Or you're stupid. Either way, respect.
That's one for the history books. Well done.
I've been in the Zone 5 years and never solo'd a $what. Respect.
Zone's got another legend. Drinks are on me.
You're either getting good or the Zone's getting lazy. Either way, impressive.
You're buying. I spent all my medkit money on not dying.
Great. Now everyone's gonna try solo $what kills. Thanks for raising the bar.
Solo $what kill. Retirement fund secured. Or funeral fund. Probably funeral.
Next time bring backup. Show-off.
My squad's gonna hear about this. They're gonna want proof.
Cool story. Now go clean your gun before it jams.
You almost died though, right? RIGHT?
Legend today, corpse tomorrow. Typical Zone.
Three guys tried that $what before you. Found their gear. Thanks for not adding to the pile.
And here I am proud of killing pseudodogs. Fuck.
Emission caught me in $where. Made it to shelter with 10 seconds left.
Blowout hit while I was in the open. Barely found cover in time.
Survived my $count emission. Still can't believe it.
Was crossing $where when emission warning hit. Closest call of my life.
Found a basement with 5 seconds to spare. Heart's still pounding.
Emission caught me mid-looting. Ditched the gear and ran. Still alive.
Blowout in $where. Shelter was further than I thought. Made it anyway.
Dove into a basement covered in rats during emission. Better than dead.
Warning came late. Had to sprint through anomaly field to reach shelter.
Survived emission outside. Don't ask how. I don't know either.
How do you stay calm? I would've panicked.
What goes through your head when the warning hits?
10 seconds?! How is that even possible?
Do you ever get used to emissions?
What if there's no shelter nearby?
How many emissions have you survived?
Were you scared?
I heard emissions fry your brain. Is that true?
What's the trick to surviving blowouts?
Better to run or hide?
Panic is how you die. I've been through $count emissions. You learn to run straight, not fast.
Scared? Every time. Fear keeps you sharp. Panic kills.
Never get used to it. You just get better at not dying.
No shelter? Find one. Make one. Or pray. Usually pray.
Trick is simple: Always know where the nearest shelter is. Always.
10 seconds is a lifetime if you don't waste it panicking.
Brain damage? Probably. But I'm alive to worry about it later.
Run toward shelter, not away from emission. Zone doesn't care about your fear.
What goes through my head? Shelter location, distance, time. Math saves lives.
I count emissions like medals. Each one means I'm still here.
Lost my whole squad to a blowout because they scattered. Stay together.
Seen rookies freeze during warnings. Don't be that rookie.
Best advice I got: Treat every emission like it's your last. Because it might be.
Watched a veteran survive 20 emissions. Died on 21st because he got cocky.
Zone gives you 2 minutes warning for a 3-minute killzone. Do the math.
Emissions don't discriminate. Rookie or Legend, dead is dead.
If you survive 5 emissions, you're lucky. If you survive 10, you're good. If you survive 20, you're paranoid.
Never trust the timing. Always assume you have less time than they say.
Emissions are the Zone's way of keeping the population down. Don't help it.
You'll know you're a veteran when emissions don't scare you. But they should.
Sold a $what to Sakharov for $value rubles. Easiest money of my life.
Just cashed in a $what. $value rubles. Drinks on me.
$what fetch $value now? Fuck, I'm in the wrong business.
Found a $what. Sold it for $value. Retirement fund secured.
$value for one $what. Zone's paying well today.
Artifact hunting paid off. $what sold for $value.
Never thought I'd see $value for a $what. Times are good.
Sakharov's buying $what for $value. Get your artifacts ready.
Made $value off one artifact run. $what prices are insane.
$what = $value rubles. Do the math. I'm going back to Electro.
$value?! I got half that last week for the same artifact!
You're shitting me. I sold my $what for way less.
Fuck. I knew I should've waited to sell mine.
Lucky bastard. My $what only fetched 20k.
Prices went up? Great. After I sold mine cheap.
$value? I'm getting ripped off by Sidorovich.
That's double what I made. Who'd you sell to?
Timing is everything. And apparently I have none.
I hate you. But also, where'd you find it?
Some of us risk our lives for scraps. Others get $value.
Prices are up across the board. More stalkers dying, fewer artifacts.
Ecologists are desperate. Supply shortage after the last blowout.
Market's hot right now. Get your artifacts while traders are buying.
Heard Sakharov's funding doubled. He's paying premium for everything.
Supply and demand. Economics 101. More corpses, higher prices.
Zone's killing faster than we can loot. Artifact prices skyrocketing.
Military's cracking down on smuggling. Black market prices doubled.
Faction war's disrupting trade routes. Prices reflect the chaos.
Smart traders are hoarding artifacts. Waiting for prices to peak.
This won't last. Enjoy the gold rush while it's here.
Why do we throw bolts at anomalies? Can't we just use detectors?
Is it true artifacts make you immune to radiation?
How much do I need to bribe the Military checkpoint?
Why doesn't Duty just nuke the Zone?
Can I solo X18? It's just a lab, right?
Bloodsuckers are invisible. How do you even fight them?
Is the Brain Scorcher really that dangerous?
What's the easiest way to make money in the Zone?
Do I really need anti-rad? Can't I just run fast?
How hard can Controller fights be? It's just mind tricks.
Detectors don't show HOW anomalies move. Bolts do. Learn the difference or die.
Yeah, and bloodsuckers are just misunderstood puppies. Try it and find out.
Your gun, your gear, and your dignity. Then they shoot you anyway.
Because last time someone fucked with the nuclear plant, we got THIS. You want Zone 2.0?
Solo X18? Sure. Make sure someone knows where to find your corpse.
Shoot where you HEAR them, not where you SEE them. Because you won't see them.
Brain Scorcher? Nah, it's called that ironically. Go ahead, walk right in.
Looting corpses. Yours will contribute to the economy too, eventually.
Running fast from radiation. Brilliant. Why didn't veterans think of that?
'Just mind tricks' that make you shoot yourself. But go ahead, test it.
What if WE'RE the anomaly and the Zone is normal?
Maybe it's the vodka, but I think that bloodsucker was trying to communicate.
If the Zone is alive, does it dream? And are we in its nightmare?
What if artifacts are the Zone's way of saying sorry for all the death?
Hear me out: What if Monolith is right and we're all wrong?
Anomalies are just physics having a bad day. Change my mind.
The Zone makes more sense when you're drunk. That should tell you everything.
What if emissions are the Zone sneezing? Like, we're just germs to it.
I've had so much vodka I can't tell if that's a Controller or an angry Duty member.
Serious question: If I drink enough, will radiation just... give up?
You're drunk.
Put the vodka down and back away slowly.
That's the alcohol talking. And it's saying stupid shit.
I've heard dumber things. But not many.
You need sleep. Or more vodka. Definitely not philosophy.
Zone's not alive. It's just radioactive and trying to kill us. Simple.
That's... actually not the worst theory I've heard. Still stupid though.
Buddy, the only thing communicating is your liver. And it's saying 'stop'.
Go to bed. We'll pretend this conversation never happened.
I'm not drunk enough for this conversation.
Doesn't make me wrong though. *burp*
You know what? Fuck it. Pass the bottle. I'm joining you in crazy town.
Cheeki breeki, comrade. *falls over*
If anomalies are caused by psi-emissions, and vodka causes hallucinations, are we all just drunk?
Tomorrow you'll regret this. But tonight? Tonight you're a philosopher.
The Zone doesn't make sense sober. So why try?
I'm writing this down. Then burning it. But it's profound.
After enough vodka, even Duty vs Freedom makes sense. Then you sober up and it's bullshit again.
You're either a genius or an idiot. Vodka makes both look the same.
Campfire philosophy: Where dumb ideas sound smart at 2 AM.
The Zone must be contained. Leaving it unchecked is suicide for humanity.
Freedom's anarchist bullshit will doom us all. Discipline saves lives.
We're the only thing standing between the Zone and civilian populations.
Duty exists because someone has to. Freedom exists to get high and shoot at us.
Containment isn't oppression. It's survival. Freedom doesn't get that.
Contained? You mean oppressed. The Zone is humanity's next evolution.
Duty's fascist checkpoints kill more stalkers than mutants do.
No one owns the Zone. Duty's trying to control what they don't understand.
Free access to the Zone. That's what Freedom fights for. Not Duty's boot.
The Zone's a gift. Duty wants to destroy it. We want to understand it.
Evolution?! Tell that to the families of stalkers killed by your 'evolution'!
Fascist?! We're keeping the Zone from consuming cities!
Your 'gift' has killed thousands. Some fucking gift.
Free access? More like free corpses. Your ideology is a death sentence.
Oppression? Try responsibility. Something you'd know nothing about.
At least we're not bootlicking authoritarians hiding behind 'duty'.
Better dead free than alive under your checkpoints.
Duty's killed more innocents than they've saved. Prove me wrong.
Your 'containment' is just fear. Freedom doesn't fear the Zone.
You're no better than the Military. Just with a better PR team.
Both of you shut up. Zone doesn't care about your politics. It kills everyone equally.
Duty and Freedom have been arguing for years. Zone's still here. So's the death count.
You're both idiots. Different flavors, same stupidity.
While you two argue ideology, Loners are making money. Priorities.
Duty wants control. Freedom wants chaos. I want to not die. We're not the same.
Saw something in the fog near $where. Not a mutant. Something else.
The Zone is... different today. Wrong. Can you feel it?
Monolith chanting. No stalkers around. Just... voices.
Found a campfire. Still warm. No bodies. No tracks. Nothing.
Radio picked up something in $where. Not Russian. Not any language.
Anomaly moved. I swear it followed me for three hundred meters.
Trees in Pripyat are growing faster. They weren't there yesterday.
Something knocked on my shelter door. Three times. We're in the Red Forest.
Detector went haywire near $where. No artifacts. Just screaming.
The Zone's expanding. I checked the old maps. We're five klicks deeper than last year.
You're seeing things. Radiation does that.
Sure, and I saw the Wish Granter selling artifacts at Rostok.
Lay off the vodka, stalker. Zone's dangerous enough without ghost stories.
Controllers mess with your head. You probably walked past one.
Everyone who stays too long starts seeing shit. Get out for a week.
If weird shit killed stalkers, we'd all be dead. Relax.
Zone psychology 101: Your brain invents patterns in chaos.
Next you'll tell me Strelok is alive and living in the Brain Scorcher.
I've been here eight years. Seen nothing supernatural. Just death.
The Zone is bad enough without making up new horrors.
Wait. I heard the same thing. Week ago. Same location.
Not alone. Three guys from Freedom reported the exact same thing.
Sidorovich mentioned a squad went silent near there. No bodies found.
Military pulled back from that sector. Didn't say why. Just... left.
I've got footage. My helmet cam picked something up. You won't like it.
Ecologists sealed off that area. Said 'anomalous readings'. Refused to elaborate.
Old-timer at the bar mentioned the same phenomenon. Happened in 2012 too.
Duty sent a recon squad. Only one came back. Won't talk about what he saw.
Check the PDA logs. Seven different stalkers, seven identical reports.
I didn't believe it either. Until I went there. Now I do.
What if the Zone is... aware? What if it's testing us?
Scientists say the Noosphere is evolving. Maybe it's true.
The Zone took Monolith's mind. Maybe it wants more.
What if the emission wasn't an accident? What if it was a message?
Old maps show structures that don't exist. New maps show things that do. The Zone is building something.
Artifacts are getting smarter. They know when you're looking for them.
Every blowout, the Zone grows. Every growth, more anomalies. It's accelerating.
What if we're not exploring the Zone? What if it's studying us?
Monolith didn't go insane. They understood something we don't. And it broke them.
The Zone doesn't follow physics anymore. It makes its own rules now.
Doesn't matter if it's real. In the Zone, fear kills you either way.
I'm leaving. Not tomorrow. Now. This place isn't worth it anymore.
We adapt or we die. Been true since the first emission. Still true now.
Fine. Stick together. No one goes to $where alone. Ever.
Mark it on the map. Restricted zone. We'll find artifacts elsewhere.
The Zone gives. The Zone takes. Tonight it takes. Tomorrow we hunt again.
Doesn't matter what it is. Bullets work on everything. Eventually.
Zone's been weird since day one. This is just... more weird.
I've survived Controllers, Chimeras, and the military. I'll survive this too.
Welcome to the Zone. Where the impossible is just another Tuesday.
You know what scares me more? We'll all forget this conversation in a week and go back.
The Zone doesn't need to kill us. We do it for free.
I've heard this exact conversation five times. Different stalkers. Same ending. They all went back.
Fear fades. Greed doesn't. Artifact prices just went up for that sector.
The Zone doesn't care if you believe in it. It'll kill you anyway.
Fifty years from now, someone will find our bones and tell the same stories.
Every generation thinks they'll be different. Every generation dies the same.
We're all Monolith. Just haven't realized it yet.
The Zone is expanding. We're dying. And we're still arguing about it.
Cheers to another day in paradise, stalkers. Try not to disappear.
$victim_name is dead. Killed by $killer in $where.
Fuck. Not $victim_name. Anyone but $victim_name.
We just talked yesterday. They were planning to leave. Too late now.
$victim_name saved my ass twice. I wasn't there to save theirs.
Another good stalker dead. Meanwhile the assholes keep breathing.
They had a kid. Outside the Zone. Who's going to tell them?
$victim_name and I came to the Zone together. Now I'm alone.
We were supposed to get out next month. Had the money and everything.
The Zone takes everyone eventually. Just... not this soon.
I told them not to go. They laughed. Said they'd be fine.
How did it happen? Was it quick?
Ambush. They never had a chance. $killer caught them in the open.
Stalker code says we help each other. Where was everyone?
Solo run. I told them to bring backup. They didn't listen.
This is on whoever sent them there. They knew it was dangerous.
If the lookouts had done their job, $victim_name would still be alive.
The Zone didn't kill them. Greed did. One more artifact wasn't worth it.
Bad intel. Bad luck. Bad ending.
We've been getting sloppy. This is what happens when we forget the Zone doesn't forgive.
Equipment failure. Their detector died. They walked right into it.
I'm going after $killer. Who's with me?
Eye for an eye. Zone justice. Tonight.
$victim_name deserves better than us standing around talking. Let's move.
Already gearing up. $killer is mine. Anyone else wants a piece, fine.
We let this slide, it'll happen again. Someone has to draw the line.
Think. $victim_name wouldn't want you dead too. Plan first, revenge second.
Going in hot gets you killed. We do this smart or not at all.
Count me in. But we wait for intel. Revenge without tactics is suicide.
I want $killer dead too. But dying won't bring $victim_name back.
We've lost one. Don't make it worse by losing more.
Zone's a graveyard. We're just picking our plots.
Drink to the dead. Fight for the living. That's all we can do.
$victim_name knew the risks. We all do. Doesn't make it easier.
Tomorrow someone will toast to us the same way. Circle of life in the Zone.
Bury the gear. Burn the body. Forget the name. Stalker tradition.
Leaving their patch on the memorial wall. Next to three hundred others.
They wanted to die in the Zone. Guess they got their wish.
At least it was fast. Better than bleeding out in an anomaly.
Checked their stash. Left a bottle and some ammo. What they would've wanted.
To $victim_name. They died doing what they loved. We should all be so lucky.
Dropped a Pseudogiant near $where. Took all my ammo.
Pseudogiant? With your gear? Doubt it.
Heard the roar from two klicks away. He's not lying.
Killed a Burer before it could disarm me. Almost.
Burer kills are luck, not skill. Glad you made it.
Survived snork pack in the tunnels. Twelve of them.
Tunnels? At night? You're insane.
Poltergeist threw my own grenades back at me. The Zone is laughing.
Bandit squad tried to rob me. Tried.
Bandits aren't legendary. They're just stupid.
Why do artifacts glow?
So rookies can find them in the dark before anomalies find the rookies.
How do I know if meat is irradiated?
Eat it. If you die, it was irradiated.
Can I pet the blind dogs?
Sure. They love fingers.
Why doesn't anyone use maps?
Because the Zone rearranges itself to spite cartographers.
Is Pripyat safe during the day?
Absolutely. Monolith only shoots at night. *eyeroll*
Sidorovich is buying Moonlight artifacts for 80k. Someone tipped him off.
Sidorovich never pays that much without a reason. What's he know?
Trader scammed me. Sold me a "Goldfish". It's painted glass.
First time? Everyone gets scammed once. Now you know.
Ecologists paying triple for mutant parts. Research grant came through.
Triple? Time to go hunting.
Barkeep raised vodka prices again. Third time this month.
Zone's trying to kill us. Now Barkeep joins in.
Freedom's "free Zone" ideology will doom humanity. We need barriers.
Your barriers didn't stop the first emission. Won't stop the next.
Monolith proves what happens when the Zone is left unchecked.
Monolith proves what happens when governments experiment on people.
You're both wrong. Zone doesn't care about your politics. It kills everyone.
Every year, same argument. Every year, we all keep dying.
If artifacts are crystallized time... are we touching the past?
You're touching vodka. Put the bottle down.
No no, he's right. We're all time travelers. Moving forward one second per second.
Ran through the Red Forest during an emission. Made it to shelter with 10 seconds left.
Ten seconds? That's not luck. That's borrowed time.
I saw the timer on your PDA. Thought you were dead.
